key_insight: A compact, structured latent built from a new sparse omni-voxel (O-Voxel) representation encodes geometry and appearance natively, enabling high-fidelity 3D generation that handles complex topologies with far fewer resources.
problem_solved: Existing 3D representations struggle to represent complex topology and fine appearance jointly and/or are inefficient; this work provides a native, compact latent that preserves topology and appearance from raw 3D data.
method: Define O-Voxel: a sparse, per-voxel omni-channel structure that stores both geometry cues and appearance features in native 3D space.
Learn compact structured latents from native 3D assets by encoding into the O-Voxel sparsity-aware representation and decoding back for generation or rendering.
Design training and compression strategies that exploit sparsity and structure so latents remain compact while preserving topology and detailed appearance.
impact: Enables practitioners to generate and edit complex 3D assets with higher fidelity and lower compute/memory cost; useful for scalable 3D datasets, real-time applications, and hardware-efficient deployment.
visual_elements: Schematic of an O-Voxel cell showing geometry + appearance channels (icons for normals, color, density) and sparsity grid
Pipeline flowchart: native 3D data → O-Voxel encoder → compact structured latent → decoder/generator/render
Before/after comparison: complex-topology asset reconstructed by prior voxel/mesh methods vs O-Voxel output (visual fidelity and compactness metrics)
Bar/line chart comparing model size, memory usage, and reconstruction fidelity across representations
paper_title: Native and Compact Structured Latents for 3D Generation
paper_authors: Jianfeng Xiang, Xiaoxue Chen, Sicheng Xu, Ruicheng Wang, Zelong Lv
